meanings.sent1: She felt the awkwardest when she tripped in front of everyone.
meanings.sent2: It was the awkwardest silence they had ever experienced.
meanings.sent3: The awkwardest moment was when he accidentally hugged a stranger.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was so thick, you could cut it with the awkwardest knife.
meanings.sent5: The party was filled with the awkwardest conversations imaginable.

meanings.sent1: His awkwardest attempts at juggling always ended in dropped balls.
meanings.sent2: She was the awkwardest dancer at the recital.
meanings.sent3: His awkwardest move was trying to fix the leaky faucet with a hammer.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers felt like the awkwardest twigs as she tried to thread the needle.
meanings.sent5: The painter's brushstrokes were the awkwardest strokes on the canvas.

meanings.definition: Most difficult to deal with or handle.
meanings.sent1: The awkwardest customer demanded to speak to the manager.
meanings.sent2: Dealing with his awkwardest moods was always a challenge.
meanings.sent3: The awkwardest situation arose when both friends showed up in the same outfit.
meanings.sent4: The problem was like the awkwardest puzzle with missing pieces.
meanings.sent5: Navigating through the forest at night was the awkwardest task they faced.
